Articles.Content:
Myself and @Beale are collaborating on a modular part set for very heavy payloads, based on Energia and its prospective derivatives, using a 5m diameter core and 2.5m diameter boosters.

Download from SpaceDock (1.2)

Download from CurseForge (1.2)

Download from Dropbox (1.2)

Part List

Spoiler

5m

  • Tanks of various lengths
  • Tank nosecone
  • Nosecone
  • Decoupler
  • Core stage engine cluster

3.75m

  • Nosecone

2.5m

  • Tanks of various lengths (mainly those not present in stock)
  • Slanted nosecone (with sepratron built in)
  • Slimline Decoupler
  • High power engine

Adapters

  • 5m->3.75m
  • 5m->2.5m

With this part set (and some stock parts) it is possible to recreate your own versions of Energia, Energia-M, Vulkan or Zenit. That doesn't stop you from making anything else you wish using the however, so go crazy!

1.2 Changelog

Spoiler
  • Added search tags
  • Added some missing bulkheadProfiles


On Buran, Polyus and other payloads, nothing is planned right now. Stock Mk3 parts can make a very nice Buran that should look much more to scale with the 5m parts than current 3.75m option with the NASA tanks and engines.
On the pack name, it means "Atomic Bread", because why not?

If you like this post, like @Beale's too! He's right down there, the one made of bread.

Release Thread!

Thanks for all the feedback during development!

 

AB Launchers - 2.5M Parts

My own little corner of development, a set of parts to create the Energia liquid boosters, as well as Zenit-like launch vehicles.

 

  • 18m Tank
  • 9m Tank
  • 4.5m Tank
  • Nosecone
  • Decoupler
  • Main Engine

you are truly doing gods work hooj.
Why the brick pattern?

Why the brick pattern?

A form of insulation, similar to what you may see in some real rockets:

Although, here it is arranged in a brick lattice, rather than grid.

Noice. :^)

Edited February 14, 2015 by RobotsAndSpaceships

A form of insulation, similar to what you may see in some real rockets:

http://puu.sh/eiL6f/3728132055.jpg

Although, here it is arranged in a brick lattice, rather than grid.

And there's the fact that kerbals do not limit themselves to traditional building material. We've seen wooden rockets before, so why not brick ones?
These are looking fantastic. I expect great things from you two! :-)
cool, stuff! Might use this instead of Bobcat's!

Now that's something that I'm excited for, along with Borklund's KERES.
Holy crap, Beale and hoojiwana working together! All my yes, waiting eagerly!
Beale+Hoojiwana=Stockalike Spagetification

Thankyou for the very kind words everybody! This little project has been in planning since just before Christmas, so it's wonderful to finally be able to show it off and include all you guys and gals in the development process. I've updated the OP with more information on what parts are planned as well as a few other bits on what will be coming with the pack on release.

On Buran, Polyus and other payloads, nothing is planned right now. Stock Mk3 parts can make a nice Buran that should look much more to scale with the 5m parts than current 3.75m option with the NASA tanks and engines.

On the pack name, it means "Atomic Bread", because why not? Whether this will show up in the final product is anyones guess since "AB Launchers" is much more understandable! There was a nice comment in the Tantares thread referencing "AB Engineering" and that might make it in as the part manufacturer for all the parts. That would be a nice tidy way to provide a filter for use in the VAB/SPH.

On engine gimbal, we're not sure on the final stats for the engines right at this moment, they need some in-game testing to see just how well Energia handles with Buran riding it to orbit. However, the idea of engine thrust limiting is something that might help on the core stage, though the problem with the current core engine model is that it is one part and thus, doesn't allow individual thrust limiting. Single versions of the engines are planned so potentially a "thrust plate" type part somewhat similar to that on the bottom of the Vulkan might be a good solution. What do you guys think? Single-engines and thrust plate, Energia-style single-part cluster, or both?

How have I missed that? O:
